snippet: Italy’s prime minister has warned of the danger that rising populism poses to political and economic stability. What can he do about it?
abstract: Editorial warns that the politics of populist anger are on the march across Europe, fueled by austerity, recession and the inability of mainstream politicians to revive growth, and could result in strong populist gains in European Parliament elections; contends most effective way to reduce populist anger before it further corrodes European unity would be to loosen the constraints of financial austerity that European Union governments have agreed to at Germany's behest.
lead_paragraph: Italy’s prime minister has warned of the danger that rising populism poses to political and economic stability. What can he do about it?
